intro.title: What is NIS2?
intro.text1: The NIS2 directive (Network and Information Security 2) is the new European regulatory framework for cybersecurity. It replaces the NIS1 directive and significantly expands its scope to new sectors and types of entities.
intro.text2: Applicable from October 2024, this directive imposes reinforced obligations regarding governance, risk management, incident notification and supply chain supervision.
intro.sanctionsText: Up to 10 million euros or 2% of global turnover for essential entities.

sectors.subtitle: NIS2 applies to essential and important entities in many sectors

intro.title: What is DORA?
intro.text1: The DORA regulation (Digital Operational Resilience Act) is the new European framework that harmonizes digital operational resilience requirements for the financial sector.
intro.text2: Applicable from January 2025, DORA requires financial entities to strengthen their ability to prevent, withstand and recover from ICT-related disruptions.
obligations: Threat-led penetration testing (TLPT) for significant entities
Notification of major incidents within 4 hours
Register of contracts with ICT service providers

intro.title: What is ISO 27001?
intro.text1: The ISO/IEC 27001 standard is the international reference for implementing an Information Security Management System (ISMS). It defines requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continuously improving information security.
intro.text2: ISO 27001 certification demonstrates to your clients, partners and regulators that you manage information security in a structured manner consistent with best practices.

intro.title: What is ISO/IEC 42001?
intro.text1: The ISO/IEC 42001 standard is the first international standard for artificial intelligence management systems. It provides a framework for the responsible development, deployment and use of AI.
intro.text2: This standard helps organizations manage AI-specific risks while maximizing the benefits of these emerging technologies.
intro.synergyText: ISO 42001 facilitates compliance with the European AI Act and integrates with ISO 27001 for comprehensive security and AI governance.

intro.title: What is the AI Act?
intro.text1: The AI Act is the world's first comprehensive legal framework regulating artificial intelligence. This European regulation aims to ensure that AI systems placed on the European market are safe and respect fundamental rights.
intro.text2: Based on a risk-based approach, the AI Act imposes differentiated obligations depending on the risk level presented by each AI system.
intro.warningText: Violations can result in fines of up to 35 million euros or 7% of global turnover.

examples: Real-time biometric identification in public spaces

intro.title: What is VARA?
intro.text1: VARA (Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority) is Dubai's virtual asset regulatory authority. It supervises all crypto-asset activities in the emirate, from exchange to custody and advisory services.
intro.text2: To operate in Dubai, Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs) must obtain a VARA license and comply with strict governance, security and compliance requirements.
